Comments_List: I improved my writing skills and reading ability.
Understanding of types and expressions of nostalgia and how they influence literature, politics, social dynamics, and personal lives
How to write logicall and succinctly, how to read, some fundamental ideas of memory studies, how memory impacts our understanding of self and the collective

I developed my ability to read more critically and engage in meaningful discussions about readings. I learned unique and varied perspectives of nostalgia as it appears in everyday life, politics, and more. I also learned to sharpen my writing, improving the language and style of my essays.
learned how to better craft an argument and organize my essays
I learned where my weaknesses are as a writer and what I can do to improve on them.
The class is very enjoyable. It is structured in a way that keeps the students engaged with the material and is very fair in grades.

Strengths: interesting topic, readings were selected thoughtfully, variety of media used (movie, books, scholarly articles, some fiction to supplement); Weaknesses: can be very theoretical, complex topic to understand especially with first few highly philosophical readings, difficult to write essays on at first when asked to analyze authors' arguments

Strength: the interesting topics, discussions, the instructor 
Weaknesses: n/a
more modern and  applicable material where we can see daily influences
Yes. I think that English 114 is a great way to improve writing.
yes because material is interesting but be prepared to work hard in this course, definitely one of the harder 114s taught. but creative essays do come out of it!
Yes: especially first years looking to improve their writing and learn how to write for college

Yes, if you are at all interested in nostalgia (or are yourself nostalgic) the courses provides new lens to analyze that interest. Take the course especially if it is taught by Professor Hill, who generates great discussions and gives clear feedback on essays.
Yes, I would highly recommend this course for any student looking to hone their writing skills in a discussion based setting.
